rmp.university: University of North Carolina at Chapel Hill
comments: Dr. Ariel veered away from the syllabus to say the least. There was a required reading of at least one novel, usually more per class.  The readings were dense, the videos were boring, he was confusing, not to mention the 12 pg term paper. I would not recommend. He was also HATEFUL if you ever had to miss a class, even if you were sick.

Attendance is mandatory, but you really don't have to pay much attention as long as you look at the study guide before tests. Requires a lot of outside commitment - visiting synagogues and outside lectures. Ariel is funny and the TAs were helpful this semester.

Professor Ariel's class is a lot of work, but not overly hard. His lectures are somewhat unclear, but he tries. My issue is with the TAs. Don't expect to get anything graded back until a month after you submitted it. They are some of the laziest people on the planet.

Professor Ariel is very passionate about the subject. The workload isn't too bad. I learned a lot in RELI 72. If you are looking for an easy first-year seminar, do not take RELI 72. It's not that hard, but it is harder than most first-year seminars. I will say that Prof Ariel tends to interrupt people - even the guest lecturers. Don't take offense.
